intro: Ligusticum purpureum, commonly known as purple lovage, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 60–100 cm, with finely divided, fern-like leaves that emit a strong, spicy odor when crushed. Its flowers are small and white to pale purple, forming dense clusters at the top of the stems. Purple lovage is often found in moist, calcareous soils and is valued for its ornamental and medicinal properties.
